contents.context:
Good afternoon. The temperature pattern looks to be similar to what we've been seeing recently, big swings to continue from chilly mornings to balmy afternoons.

Meanwhile, the dryness in the air remains in many inland regions a warning is still in place for the capital and parts of Gyeonggi-do Province. The wind will also get stronger with a preliminary wind advisory issued for the east coast.

Afternoon highs will be similar to slightly higher than yesterday, getting up to the upper teens.

Saturday is Cheongmyeong, the 5th spring term out of 6meaning clear bright skies and we'll have sunny skies this weekend but do expect a bright spring chill on Sunday morning, which is Arbor Day.

The weather looks promising for next week with dry conditions to persist with wide temperature gaps.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Chilly start turns mild under bright skies
Updated: 2020-04-03 05:58:32 KST

contents.context:
Flowers have begun to bloom thanks to the sunny weather we've been having, but the air is extremely dry in the Korean capital.
Let's turn to our Lee Seung-min at the Weather Center to find out more. Seung-min, which areas are affected the most?

Connyoung, the air is getting drier in most regions. Dry weather advisories are in place in Seoul and parts of Gyeonggi-do Province for the first time this year. Additional dry weather alerts have been placed in Daegu and the surrounding Gyeongsangbuk-do Province. No rain is forecasted for a while, so please take precautions against fires.

Taking a closer look at our readings for tomorrow. We'll have a bit of a chilly start to the day in Seoul at 5 degrees Celsius, Daegu 6 and Jeju 10, with fine dust levels standing at 'normal'.

The highs will be similar to today's. In Seoul, temperatures will reach 16 degrees Celsius, Daejeon 19 and Busan 18. However, we have large temperature gaps between day and night of more than 10 degrees, so please dress accordingly.

During the day tomorrow, Tokyo will see periodic clouds, while Beijing will be sunny.

I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : xtinalee93@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Dry weather to continue, 'normal' fine dust levels
Updated: 2020-04-02 17:15:28 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. The season's first dry weather warning has been issued for Seoul and parts of Gyeonggi-do Province since yesterday afternoon, as humidity levels are only half of what we normally see at this time of year.

Temperature-wise, most parts had a far chillier morning today but highs will rise rapidly along with bright skies, so there is another big temperature gap between highs and lows.

This afternoon, highs will be marginally cooler but still a couple of notches above the seasonal norms. We'll see mostly sunny skies and good air quality nationwide.

There's a risk of forest fires as dry conditions are set to continue so be extra careful if you are handling fire. Also this Sunday, which is Arbor Day, we are looking at a brief spring chill to arrive with a low of 2 degrees Celsius.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Dry, sunny and warm afternoon in store
Updated: 2020-04-02 07:57:19 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. Seoul and parts of Gyeonggi-do Province have been under dry weather warnings since yesterday afternoon, as humidity levels are only half of what we normally see this time of year. Drink plenty of water and be extra careful if you are handling fire.

Temperature-wise, it's far chillier this morning and it's windy. Dress a bit warmer than yesterday, while highs will also be slightly lower this afternoon.

Winds have died down compared to yesterday but it's still chilly outside with temperatures starting out at 3 degrees in Gyeongju and Daejeon, Chuncheon at 1 degree.

Afternoon highs will be marginally cooler today but still above the norms then we'll see mostly sunny skies and breathable air quality nationwide.

There will be a brief spring chill on Sunday morning at a low of 2 degrees while bright skies will dominate the country.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.

contents.headline:
Chilly start, mild afternoon
Updated: 2020-04-02 06:04:01 KST

contents.context:
The start of April was warm but dry here in Seoul. In fact, Seoul is now under a dry weather warning. For more details, let's check with Lee Jeehyun at the Weather Center. Jeehyun, so what's the normal humidity level around this time of and how far below that are we?

Hello, Connyoung. Yes, Seoul is under a dry weather warning now. In spring, health experts recommend maintaining an indoor humidity level of between 50 and 60 percent. But as we can see, it's only half that outside right now, so we need to humidify our homes and drink at least 2 liters of water a day.

Also be extra careful when handling fire because there's no precipitation in the forecast for the time being in the capital area. Temperatures will continue to be on the mild side with wide gaps between the lows and highs.

It's going to be a breezier morning tomorrow compared to today, though. Seoul and Daegu at 5 degrees. Chuncheon chilly at 1 degree.

The highs will shoot up into the upper teens, a couple notches lower than today. Sunny skies and cleaner air across the country.

Meanwhile, Beijing will have a sunny Thursday at a high of 21 degrees, Tokyo will get some afternoon rain.

And now, I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
Sunny and dry Thursday ahead
Updated: 2020-04-01 17:22:11 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. Weather conditions will vary depending on where you are on this first day of April, Jeju and the south coast will see light spring showers, which will let up before noon. The east coast will see rain through tonight with 5 to 10 millimeters expected.

North-western regions, including Seoul, will have a dry and dust day. The capital area is under a dry weather advisory for the 5th day in a row and central regions and Jeollabuk-do Province will need to be aware of high levels of fine dust.

Nothing much to complain about temperature-wise, afternoon highs will be hovering around 20 degrees Celsius. Jeju will be breezier at 15 degrees. Much more sunshine on the way for the latter half of the day.

It will be cooler tomorrow morning, but highs will remain above the norms. Dress accordingly as wide temperature gaps will continue.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com

contents.headline:
Rain on east coast, warm highs
Updated: 2020-04-01 07:59:33 KST

contents.context:
Good morning. For the first day of April, weather conditions will vary depending on where you are. As we can see, Jeju and south coast are receiving light spring showers which will let up in the morning while the east coast will see rain through late tonight.

The precipitation won't be too much, though, eastern parts of Gangwon-do Province will see 5 to 10 millimeters.

Readings will continue to hover way above the seasonal norms, nothing much to complain about weather-wise, but the capital area is still under a dry weather advisory and beware of high levels of fine dust.

Taking a closer look at today's readings, lots of clouds to start the day in most regionsSeoul beginning the day at 10 degrees, Gyeongju at 8 degrees with showers.

contents.headline:
Rain on Jeju and south coat in morning, warm temperatures
Updated: 2020-04-01 06:04:58 KST

contents.context:
There hasn't been much to complain about weather-wise on this last day of Marchanother fine spring day with fairly clear skies.
For more details, let's check with Lee Jeehyun at the Weather Center.
Jeehyun, usually around this time of year, along with the pleasant spring weather, Korea gets choked by toxic smog but that doesn't seem to have been the case so far this spring.

Yes, we have cleaner air this year. If you remember last March, air quality was 9 to 13 times worse than normal with dust advisories frequently being issued across the country. This March, no dust advisories were issued. But for tomorrow, those of us in the capital area, Chungcheong-do and Jeolla-do Provinces will need to beware of relatively high levels of fine dust during the day. The rest of the country will have decent air quality.

Those of you on Jeju Island, and on the south and east coasts will receive some light showers. Jeju and the south coast to see showers from midnight into tomorrow morning, the east coast will receive showers from tomorrow afternoon.

Temperature-wise, it'll be a breezy morning to start the day, Gyeongju will be quite chilly at 3 degrees Celsius.

The highs will jump more than 10 degrees by the afternoon again in most areas, rising into the upper teens while Daegu will reach 20 degrees.

Beijing will have a mostly sunny Wednesday, Tokyo will receive afternoon rain.

And now, I'll leave you with the weather conditions around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
contents.headline:
More fine spring weather on Wednesday, rain on Jeju and south and east coasts
Updated: 2020-03-31 17:09:03 KST

contents.context:
Good afternoon. March looks to end on a bright and balmy note on Tuesday. Temperatures will hover way above the seasonal average across the country.

Meanwhile, central west regions could see high levels of fine dust in the morning so keep an eye out for that, while a dry weather advisory is in place for those regions including Seoul for the 4th day in a row.

We had sunny skies to kick off the day but more clouds will move in later. A balmy afternoon is in store with highs ranging from 16 to 21 degrees Celsius.

Jeju as well as Korea's south and east coasts will see rain from late tonight into early Wednesday morning while the capital will remain sunny and warm. But be prepared for the big temperature differences between the lows and highs.

That's Korea for you and here's the international weather for viewers around the world.
Reporter : jee8525@gmail.com
